column4: LF: Anyone who can walk me through changing my splash screen + login screen to the "login scan fusion" offered by gnome art under the "Get more themes online" option in the appearance menu.

LFcontinued: Have tried youtube and all other sites listed under google search "changing login and spalsh, ubuntu 9.10." running into problem as follows: (Can't seem to install the login scan fusion theme from gnome art as a proper theme.)
try apt-get install startupmanager
trying now, one moment please.
Permissions denied.
startupmanager is a program that lets you change your boot splash
Opened under "sudo apt-get," installing now.
Installation complete, please proceed with advice.
it should have installed a menu item somewhere, probably administration or preferences
try just: sudo startupmanager
Operation complete. Accessed properly. Looking at Startup-Manager. On Appearances tab. Do I need to add all images from my login-scan-fusion folder?
startupmanager only handles the boot splash, not the login screen
Alright, I'll load the Splash image I've got via the "Bootloader themes" option, correct?
unfortunately, it seems they didn't add much customizability to the new login screen config
no, not bootloader
Correction accepted. One moment please.

Operation cannot be completed. Splash-DeepBlue.png is not an acceptable format. When trying to open it, and "save as: Splash-DeepBlue.so," operation failed. *.so is not an acceptable format. Please advise.
.png files are not a splash or login theme, they're just an image
Is there a way to convert it to a splash format?
I'm not sure

When downloading splash screens from the gnome art website you get to via "Get more themes online" option under preferrences, you have to right click "save image as" <image name>.so and it will load properly in startupmanager.
(Problem: Logging out to view the new splash screen does not show the splash screen change. Seeking alternate options at a later time. Thank you for your help.)
